title: bark up the wrong tree
description: to have a mistaken idea, or to direct one's attention to the wrong person or thing

title: be a catalyst for
description: to cause or accelerate an event, or to cause a great change

title: be short of time
description: to not have enough time to do something

title: beat around the bush
description: to avoid talking about the main topic or issue

title: big kid at heart
description: a person who enjoys playing and having fun like a child

title: biodegradable
description: able to decompose naturally without causing environmental pollution

title: biodiversity
description: the variety of plant and animal species in an area

title: blackmail
description: to force a person to do something by threatening to reveal a secret about them

title: blow the whistle
description: to report a crime to the police

title: brain dump
description: to write down all your thoughts on a topic

title: brake
description: a device that is used to slow or stop a vehicle

title: bribery
description: the act of giving money to a person in exchange for a favor

title: brush up on
description: to improve your knowledge or skill at something you haven't used in a while

title: buckle up
description: to fasten a seatbelt in a car

title: bury oneself in
description: to focus completely on doing something

title: buzz
description: a low humming sound, or a feeling of excitement or energy

title: can't make heads or tails
description: to be unable to understand something

title: carjacking
description: stealing a car with the driver still inside

title: cease
description: to stop or to bring something to an end

title: change lanes
description: to move your vehicle to another lane on the road

title: charge
description: to formally accuse someone of a crime

title: clamor
description: a loud and confused noise, especially from people shouting

title: come up roses
description: to turn out successfully after a difficult start

title: commence
description: to begin or start something

title: commit
description: to do something illegal or wrong (e.g. a crime)
